resume.title: Resume
resume.name: Jason Han
resume.mainSubTitle: From Entrepreneurship to Code: My Developer Journey
resume.content1.paragraph1:
I'm a Web Developer with a diverse background in sales, marketing, project management, professional day trading, and over 10 years running my own business.

A few years ago I started learning to code and have focused on JavaScript (ES6+), React, and Styled Components while working full-time as a hardware engineer. That has given me a strong foundation in building engaging designs and interactive features for web applications.

From my previous roles I bring transferable skills in communication, problem-solving, and adaptability, and I keep up with new tools and trends to find efficient solutions to complex problems.

I grew up in Canada and am fluent in Korean and English, which helps me work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders. As a Developer, I'm eager to apply this background to impactful projects and keep growing in web development.

I'm always open to learning and improving, and I use AI-assisted development and other tools to learn efficiently and deliver reliably. I'd be glad to discuss how my experience could support your team. Thank you for considering my profile.

skills.title: Technical Skills
skills.htmlSassLayout: Experienced in implementing layouts and responsive web apps with HTML and SASS.
skills.styledComponents: Use Styled Components to prevent styling bugs even as the app grows.
skills.tailwindCss: Experienced in utility-first styling with Tailwind CSS.

backend.nodeJs: Experienced in server-side development with Node.js.
backend.firebase: Experienced in authentication, database, and hosting with Firebase.
backend.supabase: Experienced in backend development with Supabase (PostgreSQL, Auth, Realtime).
backend.postgresql: Experienced in relational database design and queries with PostgreSQL.
backend.restfulApi: Experienced in designing and consuming RESTful APIs.

framework.title: Framework & Library
framework.statePropsComponent: Experienced in designing React components and managing state and props.
framework.spaImplementation: Experienced in implementing Single Page Applications (SPAs) using React Router.
framework.optimizationExperience: Experienced in optimizing applications using React.memo, useMemo, and useCallback.
framework.reduxToolkit: Experienced in state management with Redux Toolkit.
framework.nextJsExperience: Built server-rendered and static web apps with Next.js.
framework.angularExperience: Experienced in building web applications with Angular (approx. 2 months).

description.listItem1: I developed this project from scratch without using any templates. The reason for this approach is that when I started developing with React, I wanted to understand how web apps like a blog function. I found that working on small projects and learning the skills hands-on helped me learn more than formal study.
description.listItem2: For styling, I initially used CSS, then briefly tried SASS, and later switched to Styled Components. Using Styled Components allows for easier maintenance and eliminates unexpected styling bugs, which is a significant advantage.
description.listItem3: Responsive layout for mobile and desktop
description.listItem4: Backend uses Firebase for login, posting, editing, and deleting.

description.listItem1: Developed a full-stack construction site management application using Next.js 16, React 19, and TypeScript. Built comprehensive inventory tracking, work logging, and site management features with real-time updates.
description.listItem2: Implemented secure backend with Supabase (PostgreSQL) including Row Level Security policies, database migrations, and RESTful API routes. Integrated Supabase Auth for authentication with OAuth and email/password support.
description.listItem3: Built multi-language support (English/Korean) using next-intl with locale-aware routing. Created responsive UI with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui components for modern, accessible design.
description.listItem4: Developed role-based access control with four user roles (Worker, Manager, Owner, Admin), each with customized dashboards and permissions. Implemented real-time features using Supabase Realtime subscriptions.
description.listSubItem1: Inventory Management: Check-in/check-out system with real-time tracking
description.listSubItem2: Work Logs: Daily logging with approval workflows
description.listSubItem3: Site & Floor Management: Multi-floor configuration with drag-and-drop interface
description.listSubItem4: Role-Specific Dashboards: Tailored views for each user role
description.listItem6: Established comprehensive testing with Jest (unit/component), Playwright (E2E), and database integration tests. Maintained 90%+ coverage and TDD workflow. Deployed using three-environment architecture (Test/Staging/Production) with Vercel.

project3.title: Desktop App
project3.subtitle: YouTube Copilot – Educational Video Pre-Production Tool

description.listItem1: Educational video pre-production desktop app. Streamlines turning a topic into a structured outline, script, scene plan, and visual assets.
description.listItem2: Built with Tauri (Rust) and React + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS. Cross-platform (Windows, macOS, Linux) with local state and filesystem persistence.
description.listItem3: Scene-based workflow: segment narration, manage prompts, and track per-scene assets. Integrates with local AI (e.g. LM Studio) for outline and script generation.
description.listItem4: Visual tooling: generate images per scene and optional image-to-video generation. Pre-built installers published via GitHub Releases.
description.listSubItem1: End-to-end flow: Topic → outline → script → scenes → visual assets
description.listSubItem2: Scene-based workflow with local state and quick access to recents
description.listSubItem3: Local AI support (LM Studio); ElevenLabs TTS on macOS/Linux
description.listSubItem4: Desktop-first: Tauri app with native filesystem and local persistence
description.listItem6: Portfolio piece; many features in progress. Use the "Download app" link above for installers. Use the "View demo" link for a walkthrough video.

portfolio.description: In this project, I leveraged React with Styled Components for the frontend, while employing Firebase for seamless login processing and blog posting capabilities on the backend. To efficiently manage the application state, I utilized Redux. Despite the convenience of existing platforms, templates, or frameworks like Bootstrap and Material UI, I opted to design and develop the entire project from scratch to ensure complete control over the process and to enhance my learning experience.
